info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 23 at 2:41PM MST until December 25 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO NOON MST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, ground blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...The foothills and plains adjacent to the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Saturday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 6 AM Saturday to Noon MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
